awd_titl_txt: "WHAT IS GRADUATE SCHOOL AND HOW DO YOU SELECT ONE," A      National PBS-GEM Satellite Teleconference, October 3, 1991
awd_abstract_narration: The National Consortium for Graduate Degrees for Minorities in                  Engineering, Inc. (GEM) is funding its second teleconference.  The              overall goal of this national teleconference is to inform                       undergraduate students and employees without advanced training in               science and engineering fields of the difference between                        undergraduate education and graduate level training and                         responsibilities.  In addition, this teleconference will focus on               the process of selecting the graduate school best suited to one's               particular needs.  This information will be prepared and presented              with a multi-ethnic and multi-racial viewing audience in mind.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: NATIONAL CONSORTIUM FOR GRADUATE DEGREES FOR MINORITIES IN ENGINEERING AND SCIENCE INC.
